SEARCH
Package tradedatacorp.smelter.filesmelter

Class OHLCV_BinaryLexicalFileSmelter

java.lang.Object
tradedatacorp.smelter.filesmelter.OHLCV_BinaryLexicalFileSmelter
All Implemented Interfaces:
FileSmelterStateful<StickDouble>, Smelter<StickDouble>, SmelterStateful<StickDouble>
public class OHLCV_BinaryLexicalFileSmelter extends Object implements FileSmelterStateful<StickDouble>
The OHLCV_BinaryLexicalFileSmelter class writes StickDouble objects to a compressed binary file formatted for use with an OHLCV_BinaryLexical translator. This class has a preset Path that represents the file location and name of where the file will be written. This class has a OHLCV_BinaryLexical that specifies the bit compression formats of OHLCV Stick data.

    • OHLCV_BinaryLexicalFileSmelter

      public OHLCV_BinaryLexicalFileSmelter(OHLCV_BinaryLexical originalTranslator)
      Constructs an OHLCV_BinaryLexicalFileSmelter using the provided OHLCV_BinaryLexical translator. This will not use this classes OHLCV_BinaryLexical.
      Parameters:
      originalTranslator - The binary lexical translator used to define the bit compression format for output files.

  • Method Details

    • smelt

      public void smelt(StickDouble dataStick)
      Writes a file to the preset target path using the preset OHLCV_BinaryLexical, containing exactly one data point represented by the given dataStick. Note: Data loss may occur if this class's lexical bitfields are too small to represent the data.
      Specified by:
      smelt in interface Smelter<StickDouble>
      Parameters:
      dataStick - The StickDouble instance to serialize and write to the file.

      smelt in interface Smelter<StickDouble>

    • smeltQueueToFile

      public void smeltQueueToFile(Path destinationPathName, ArrayDeque<StickDouble> stickQueue)
      Processes all StickDouble data sticks contained in the provided queue and writes them to a file at the specified destination path. Each data stick is converted to a binary representation using the preset OHLCV_BinaryLexical, then written sequentially to the output file.
      Parameters:
      destinationPathName - the path and filename for the output file.
      stickQueue - the queue of StickDouble instances to process and write.

    • writeDataToNewFile

      public void writeDataToNewFile(Path file, ArrayDeque<boolean[]> dataQueue)
      Writes the contents of a queue of binary data to a file at the specified path.

      This method performs a multi-stage, threaded transformation and serialization pipeline:

      • Prepares a binary header according to the binaryTranslator's settings.
      • Converts and aligns data bits from the input queue for file output.
      • Spawns four worker threads to process and write the data in parallel, maximizing throughput.
      • The output file is always overwritten, never appended.

      The method is **thread-safe** with respect to the provided dataQueue and uses synchronization to protect shared resources.

      Side Effects: The provided dataQueue is not modified by this method. However, the output file at file will be overwritten.

      Exceptions: Any I/O or thread interruption exceptions are caught and printed to standard error; the method will return early on file open failure.

      Parameters:
      file - the target file Path where binary data will be written; the file will be created or overwritten.
      dataQueue - a queue of boolean arrays, each representing a single data record to serialize and write.
